discourse_list.title: RWA Legal Structure IP - Should this be protected?

content.content: Folks as I get my feet wet in Maker stuff again something came to mind regarding all the Legal IP being constructed by our RWA vault seekers. Specifically 6s, and Centrifuge.   A lot of the legal structures (at least on the 6s side) are basically public.  The informational details behind the collateral is private but the paperwork to construct these RWA structures is public. I see this as key IP being constructed by these entities that by posting it publicly we are just giving it away without restrictions or rights.   Honestly I don’t think this stuff is cheap to create and I don’t think we should just be handing it out to the world to fork/copy and compete against Maker and our important partners. So I bring up the questions both to 6s and Centrifuge how we should handle this?   I think it is important for groups of people to review this stuff.   But I also think it is just as important for the information on these structures to be protected somehow legally.   You would be the jurisdictional entities to copy/IP protect these and then the ones to take action.    This really isn’t Maker IP it is 6s/Centrifuge Legal IP. My assumption is both 6s and Centrifuge have thought of this and taken appropriate action but I just wanted to bring this up for comment when we are considering collaborating or Partnering with anyone either for legal reviews or contract audit assistance. Comment/discussion?
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is questioning whether the legal structures created by RWA vault seekers, specifically 6s and Centrifuge, should be protected as intellectual property. The author believes that by posting the paperwork publicly, they are giving away key IP without restrictions or rights. The author suggests that the information on these structures should be protected legally, and asks for feedback on how to handle this. The post explains the proposal and asks for constructive criticism and discussion.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Well, @mrabino1 did 6S and paid for the legal research, so that’s not really ours. I’m also unsure if legal structures are IP. I don’t think they are. Also seems to run against our “permissionless” and “opening finance to everyone” mission. I do agree we should make sure legal expenses borne by Maker are not to build out the actual viable product for a business partner.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: PaperImperium:  Well, @mrabino1 did 6S and paid for the legal research, so that’s not really ours. I’m also unsure if legal structures are IP. I don’t think they are. Also seems to run against our “permissionless” and “opening finance to everyone” mission   This is my point is that is it IP, it isn’t Maker’s so this is not ‘our responsibility’ but it is something to be cognizant of.    @mrabino1 just replied to me that legal structures “legal docs have no IP / copyright protection”.   He is aware that this is a ‘gift’ to the entire space he is paying for and “wants competition”. So to nip my own thread in the bud and left for posterity. Legal docs have no IP/copyright protection so they are fair game. Honestly given the price to make these things I find it ironic they don’t lol but given they are filed publicly I guess it makes sense.  Make a new legal structure and everyone gets it for free. Legal structures are ‘forkable’.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
